page.title: 18A day at School.
page.content: The school day follows a regular pattern. We start with Assembly, which one day a week we prepare ourselves. The recorder players play for the hymns. At 0930 lessons start which take us to breaktime at 1040. A quarter of an hour to play and then another hour of lessons before washing in time for lunch. School dinners are cooked in the school's kitchen. After lunch we can play chess or use the computer; outside if it has been raining we are restricted to the playground, but for most of the summer and autumn terms we can use the school field. We can play ball games. We return to the classrooms at 1330. The afternoons are more fun as part of each are spent in such lessons as Art & Craft, Music, Dancing, Swimming - we go to Marlow in a coach, Games, P.E. and Cookery. At last 1540 and hometime!
